raw_text:
Ray Charles studio becomes museum
 
 A museum dedicated to the career of the late legendary singer Ray Charles is to open in his former recording studio in Los Angeles.
 
 His longtime publicist Jerry Digney said the museum would house "archive materials from recordings, to awards, to ephemera, to wardrobe". A tour bus used by Charles and his entourage over the years will also be on permanent display. It is hoped the museum will be ready for visitors in late 2007.
 
 Mr Digney said the recording studio and offices had been used by Charles for many years, and was where he recorded much of his last album, Genius Loves Company. It is hoped the museum will also house an education centre. The building had been declared a historic landmark by the city of Los Angeles just before Charles' death in June 2004 at the age of 73. Following his death, Charles won eight Grammy Awards, including album of the year for Genius Loves Company, a collection of duets.

A tour bus used by Charles will be displayed permanently. The building was declared a historic landmark before Charles' death in 2004.

deepseek-r1:1.5b:
<think>
Alright, let's tackle this query step by step. The user wants a summary of a text about a museum dedicated to Ray Charles, his former studio, and some notable details.

First, I need to understand what the original text is about. It mentions that a museum in Los Angeles will be built to showcase Ray Charles' career materials, including recordings, awards, ephemera, and wardrobes. Jerry Digney, Ray's old publicist, said this museum will house these items. There's also a tour bus from their years, which will be on display too.

Mr. Digney mentioned that the studio was used for many years by Charles, where he recorded his last album, Genius Loves Company. The museum aims to have an education center there as well. The building was recognized as historic by LA at the time of his death in June 2004 and after his death, he won several Grammy Awards.

Now, I need to condense all this into a concise summary. I should include key points: the museum's purpose, what it will display ( recording materials, awards, ephemera), the tour bus on display, the education center, and the historical status of the building. Also, mention that they're aiming for visitors in late 2007.

I have to make sure not to add any extra information beyond the essential details, just plain text without explanations or formatting. So, I'll structure it as a single sentence summarizing each main point clearly.
</think>

A museum dedicated to Ray Charles' career will open in Los Angeles' former recording studio. It aims to display audio recordings, awards, ephemera, and wardrobes. A tour bus from his years will also be on display. The museum hopes it'll be ready for visitors by late 2007. Mr. Digney stated the studio was used for many years and where he recorded Genius Loves Company. A dedicated education center is planned, with the historic Los Angeles building recognized at that time.

The museum will also have an education center on the building's history and significance. The announcement of the museum's creation comes just weeks before Charles' death in June 2004 at the age of 73. He won eight Grammy Awards, including album of the year for Genius Lovees Company, a collection of his duets.

The museum is set to be open late 2007 in Los Angeles' Ray Charles studio, which was once a fixture on his recording sessions. An education center is also planned for the site. Opening in late 2007, the museum aims to provide an immersive experience of Ray Charles' life and music.
